alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 4:18PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Near Lake Arthur affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Pecos River near Lake Arthur. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday morning to a crest of 20.8 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.6 feet on 10/07/1954. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Pecos River Lake Arthu 20.0 12.5 Thu 3 pm MDT 17.3 20.4 16.1 &&
info.instruction: To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Friday morning around 715 AM MDT.
